cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 175 km (110 mi) west of the Dry Tortugas, FL
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest-then-north toward the northern Gulf Coast (Florida Panhandle / southeast Alabama)
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle near Panama City–Fort Walton Beach area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Alabama/Florida border eastward to Ochlockonee River, FL (northern Gulf Coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Alabama through Florida Big Bend; inland GA and western Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Occasional tropical-storm-gusts possible (20-30 mph) Monday night–Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side near Jacksonville
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands Monday night–Tuesday could drop 1-3 inches, locally near 4 inches
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado risk in outer rain bands; rough surf/rip-currents along NE Florida beaches
